intro: Canthium paucinervium, commonly known as the slender spiny sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spiny leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Canthium paucinervium is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
